sentences.english: This is the stock quotes. This is an anti-virus software.
sentences.chinese: 这是股票报价信息表，这是一个杀毒软件。

sentences.english: Higuchi reads a quote from an elderly man who returned for the reunion.
sentences.chinese: 樋口读取从一个老人团聚返回的报价。

sentences.english: Liaising and expediting approval of the quotation with the client.
sentences.chinese: 联系客户，并加快对客户报价的审批。

sentences.english: That’s okay. Give them a quote.
sentences.chinese: 那就这样吧，给他们一个报价。

sentences.english: We have carefully studied the socks you put on my offer advice.
sentences.chinese: 我们已仔细研究了你放对我短袜报价意见。

sentences.english: Prices on the item tender offer sheet shall be filled out in the following manner.
sentences.chinese: 投标分项报价表上的价格应按下列方式分开填写。

sentences.english: I will send the quotation sheet and samples to you immediately after receiving your detailed enquiry .
sentences.chinese: 在收到你方具体询价时，我将立即寄上报价单及样品。

sentences.english: The paper also expresses its view on a couple of issues concerning the quotation of price preparation for track - laying …
sentences.chinese: 笔者就编制铺轨架梁报价的几个具体问题提出了看法。

sentences.english: Look at list-to-sales price ratios, which is the difference between the listing price of a home and the price at which it sold.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看看房屋出售报价和实际售价之间的价差。

sentences.english: Anka's Quoted Tuition Rate is the net price before taxes.
sentences.chinese: 本校报价的学费是税前价格。

sentences.english: You is a little behind the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 你方报价比最后期限晚了一些。

sentences.english: We can obtain the same quality through another channel at much lower price than that you quoted us.
sentences.chinese: 我方可以以比你方报价低的价格从其他渠道购买商品。

sentences.english: If you would like to purchase this domain name, please email to make an offer.
sentences.chinese: 如果您对该域名感兴趣，请向发邮件提供您的报价。

sentences.english: Supported Product quotations to win New Business Opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 支持产品报价以赢得新业务机会。

sentences.english: Fees will be charged for real-time quotes of Hong Kong Stocks only, details are enclosed overleaf.
sentences.chinese: 将仅就港股即时报价收取费用，收费详情载于背页。

definition: asking price/to ask a price/to demand terms (in negotiations)
to quote a price/seller's first offer
merchandise or commodities available immediately after sale/merchandise in stock/available item/actuals (investment)/actual commodities
